==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ほん|ま|yomi=ok}}

===Etymology===
Probably coined in Japan, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ほんま|本|tr1=hon|t1=main, this, the current; real|真|tr2=ma|t2=real, true, genuine}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=j|ほんま|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ほんま}}

# [[truth]], [[reality]]

====Usage notes====
Used [[attributively]] as a noun, taking the [[possessive]] particle {{ja-r|の}}.
: {{ja-usex|'''本真'''の話やで。|'''ほんま''' の はなし や で。|It's a '''true''' story, I tell you!}}
Also used [[adverbially]], taking the particle {{ja-r|に}}.
: {{ja-usex|'''本真'''に驚いたわ。|'''ほんま''' に おどろいた わ。|I was '''really''' surprised.}}

May be more common in [[Kansai]] and other areas in the west of Japan.
